pull.title: qt: Remove QFont warnings with QT_QPA_PLATFORM=minimal
pull.body:
This PR removes massive warnings like:
```
QWARN  : ... QFont::setPointSizeF: Point size <= 0 (...), must be greater than 0
```

from `test_bitcoin-qt` output.

On master (e258ce792a4849927a6db51786732d71cbbb65fc):
```
$ ./src/qt/test/test_bitcoin-qt | grep QFont | wc -l
~BitcoinApplication : Stopping thread
~BitcoinApplication : Stopped thread
57
```

With this PR:
```
$ ./src/qt/test/test_bitcoin-qt | grep QFont | wc -l
~BitcoinApplication : Stopping thread
~BitcoinApplication : Stopped thread
0
```

rename.from: qa, qt: Remove QFont warnings with QT_QPA_PLATFORM=minimal
rename.to: qt: Remove QFont warnings with QT_QPA_PLATFORM=minimal

events.body: ACK 8ab99dd9544e6fa61da1cd77922c85e2970c0416 -- tests should be silent in the absence of errors: thanks for fixing! :)

Not sure about this change. What if this is eventually fixed on Qt? Are these warnings worth the change?

Alternatively you could filter the warning in `DebugMessageHandler` or even call `qInstallMessageHandler` with a specific test message handler.

Either way a comment explaining the condition would be nice.

Updated 8ab99dd9544e6fa61da1cd77922c85e2970c0416 -> d318a14cc87f672198aea7490d76950919357f7d ([pr17908.01](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr17908.01) -> [pr17908.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr17908.02), [compare](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr17908.01..pr17908.02)).

@promag  
> Not sure about this change. What if this is eventually fixed on Qt? Are these warnings worth the change?

Tests should not be noisy, IMO. 57 warnings messages look spammy ;)

> Either way a comment explaining the condition would be nice.

A comment has been added.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #18897 (qt: Handle exceptions instead of crash by hebasto)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

issue.title: build: Enable -Wsuggest-override if available
issue.body:
From GCC [docs](https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc-9.2.0/gcc/Warning-Options.html):
> `-Wsuggest-override`
> Warn about overriding virtual functions that are not marked with the override keyword.

~This PR is based on #16722 (the first commit).~ See: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16722#issuecomment-584111086

events.body:
> Alternatively you could filter the warning in `DebugMessageHandler` or even call `qInstallMessageHandler` with a specific test message handler.

@hebasto have you considered this approach?

@promag 
> > Alternatively you could filter the warning in `DebugMessageHandler` or even call `qInstallMessageHandler` with a specific test message handler.
> 
> @hebasto have you considered this approach?

- it seems `DebugMessageHandler` is not used in `test_bitcoin-qt`

- `qInstallMessageHandler` with a specific test message handler could suppress warnings for possible new cases in the future

issue.title: qt: Handle exceptions instead of crash
issue.body:
Related issue #18643.

With this PR the GUI handles the wallet-related exception, displays it to a user:

![Screenshot from 2020-05-06 18-16-51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/81194870-d306f800-8fc5-11ea-860a-b9510bb3bd2b.png)

and, if the exception is a non-fatal error, leaves the main window running.

qt: Remove QFont warnings with QPA=minimal

events.message: qt: Remove QFont warnings with QPA=minimal

events.body: Rebased 2a388bdf8f6685d639713c903443458afc2458e2 -> 1122817c194ed49abf896e68604e725c3b5c8569 ([pr17908.04](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr17908.04) -> [pr17908.05](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr17908.05)) due to the conflict with #16710.

Code review ACK 1122817c194ed49abf896e68604e725c3b5c8569.

Only Qt issue I found that could be related is https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-72335.

comments.body:
Why is this change needed? And what is the observable change?

https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qfontinfo.html#details
If `QT_QPA_PLATFORM=minimal` (i.e., without window system integration), `QFontInfo(QFont()).pointSize()` returns `-1`.
I see, but when QT_QPA_PLATFORM is set to something else, we actually want the values that are used to draw the text, not the point size of `QFont{}`, no?
It seems there is no harm when `RPCConsole::setFontSize()` is called. With non-`qminimal` plugin Qt always could draw a correct font.
I am not an expert in qt, and it might work for you. But in the general case it might depend on the fonts that are selected in the system settings.

[Qt Documentation -> Drawing and Filling](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/paintsystem.html):
> Qt will use the font with the specified attributes, or if no matching font exists, Qt will use the closest matching installed font.
If you keep this approach maybe refactor this to something like `GUIUtil::popup(contextMenu, ...)` and remove the new include which is already in guiutil.cpp.
nit, I'd name `popupMenu`, not sure why the `Q` prefix.
nit, `QApplication` just to make it clear what's the required include.
